content:
• Friday, March 20, 2015
  • CMCM

    Cheetah Mobile drops 5.9% in spite of Q4 beat, strong Q1 guidance

    • Cheetah Mobile's (NYSE:CMCM) Q4 revenue of $94.9M (+119% Y/Y) beat a $91.8M consensus, and EPS of $0.10 was slightly above a $0.09 consensus. Likewise, Q1 revenue guidance of $103M-$105M (+103-106% Y/Y) is above a $100.8M consensus.
    • Q4 ad revenue rose 109.9% Y/Y to $71.9M, and value-added service revenue (PC/mobile game-driven) rose 226.1% to $22.1M. On the other hand, Internet security service/other revenue fell 60.4% to $0.9M; Cheetah attributes this to subscription services no longer being emphasized.
    • Mobile revenue rose 610% to $35.8M (38% of total revenue), and monthly active users 137.9% to 395.4M. 69% of mobile MAUs were outside of China. Overseas users accounted for 24% of total revenue and 63% of mobile revenue.
    • A 116.3% Y/Y increase in operating expenses (non-GAAP) to $55.3M might have some investors on edge - R&D spend rose 95.7%, sales/marketing 115.1%, and G&A 175.5%. Also: Gross margin fell to 76.1% from Q3's 77% and Q4 2013's 81.2%.
    • After opening slightly higher, Cheetah fell to $17.53 in regular trading.
    • Q4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 5 Comments
  • YOKU

    Youku posts 10.9% decline; Street worried about content spend, SEC

    • Down only modestly in AH trading yesterday after posting mixed Q4 results, offering above-consensus Q1 sales guidance, and disclosing SEC inquiries, Youku (NYSE:YOKU) gradually sold off to new 52-week lows today.
    • Deutsche's Vivian Hao downgraded to Sell, and cut her target to $10.90 from $18.60. "We believe Youku is facing increasing pressure from the content arms race and market share challenges following a year of 'conservative progression.'"
    • Hao notes Youku, which already saw content spend rise to 47% of revenue in Q4 from 38% a year earlier, plans to spend aggressively in 2015 to halt share losses to Baidu (iQiyi) and Tencent - research firm EnfoDesk estimates Youku's Chinese online video share has fallen to 22% from 25% in early 2014.
    • Brean's Fawne Jiang (Buy) remains bullish, but has cut her target by $4 to $20. "We are positive on the growth momentum of the company as YOKU continues to transform its business model ... The recent partnership with Alibaba could help the company to expand its user base, thereby improving content production and exploring new revenue streams." However, she doesn't see competitive and margin pressures abating near-term.
    • Nearly half of Youku's market cap ($2.9B) is now covered by its cash balance ($1.4B). After backing out the cash, shares trade for 1.7x 2015E sales; the 2015 revenue growth consensus is at 37.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 5 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: EWZ +7.6%. GDXJ +7.54%. SLV +7.38%. SIVR +7.17%. GDX +6.97%.
    • ETF Losers: VXX -8.36%. VNM -3.49%. UUP -2.52%. OIL -2.39%. USO -2.2%.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • OC

    Owens Corning set up for strong asphalt shingle market, upgraded at Barclays

    • Owens Corning (OC +6.8%) is upgraded to Overweight from Equal Weight with a $48 price target, raised from $41, at Barclays, which says it has become increasingly convinced that the setup for the asphalt shingle market heading into the spring is the strongest in years and provides added confidence that OC's 2015 earnings can meaningfully exceed consensus estimates.
    • Barclays believes shingle pricing will remain stable in 2015, which marks a significant inflection point after years of competitive gyrations and failed pricing attempts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • USO

    Bottom-fishers buy the USO

    • ETFs now own one-third of the most active U.S. oil futures contracts, according to the FT, and the bellwether U.S. Oil Fund (NYSEARCA:USO) has more than tripled in size this year, with assets of $3B today standing against $900M at the start of 2015 - this as crude oil prices have continued to decline.
    • Investors hoping to play a long-term bounce in oil, writes Chris Dieterich, should look for another spot as contango - oil prices on longer-dated futures above those on shorter-dated - will erode returns over time. In fact, even if oil prices rise over a period of years, one could lose a pile of money buying and holding USO.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 14 Comments

  • Notable tech gainers/decliners: QIHU, BITA, VIPS, OTIV, LXK, ENPH

    • With the Nasdaq up 0.9% (and nearing its March 2000 highs) amid a market rally, major tech gainers are easily outnumbering major decliners.
    • Following a 1.4% overnight rally in Shanghai, strong Q1 guidance from Ctrip, and a report that Sohu/Tencent's Sogou search engine is planning an IPO, a slew of Chinese tech names are posting big gains. Aside from Ctrip and Sohu, notable gainers include search/browser/security app provider Qihoo (QIHU +4.9%), sports lottery site 500.com (WBAI +12.5%), auto sites Bitauto (BITA +4.2%) and Autohome (ATHM +4.9%), online retailer Vipshop (VIPS +4.7%), data center owner 21Vianet (VNET +6.7%), polysilicon maker Daqo (DQ +6.5%), and chat/dating app owner Momo (MOMO +4.6%).
    • Other standouts include optical component vendor Oclaro (OCLR +9.6%), U.S. solar installer Solar3D (SLTD +10%), NFC reader maker On Track (OTIV +10.5%), printer maker Lexmark (LXK +3.7%), and big data/analytics software provider Hortonworks (HDP +10.2%).
    • Notable decliners include VoIP hardware/software provider Sonus (SONS -6.1%),  solar microinverter leader Enphase (ENPH -4.2%), and authentication hardware/software provider Vasco (VDSI-OLD -5.7%).
    • Qihoo is adding to Wednesday's gains, while 500.com and 21Vianet are erasing recent losses. On Track is now up 21% over the last two days. Solar3D is adding to the gains seen yesterday following a contract announcement. Vasco had rallied strongly this week before today.
    • Previously covered: Ambarella, Spherix, Envivio, Youku, Viggle, Castlight/Benefitfocus, Care.com, Ultra Clean, InterCloud, Perceptron, Violin Memory, Amtech
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella surges to new highs

    • With the help of a market rally, Ambarella (AMBA +4.5%) has rallied to fresh highs even as top customer GoPro continues to trade nearly 60% below its September highs. Today's gains come on volume of 2.15M shares vs. a 3-month daily average of 1.97M.
    • The video processor developer now trades for 32x its FY16 (ends Jan. '16) EPS consensus of $2.24; the FY16 revenue growth consensus is at 29.3%. A hefty 9.2M shares (32% of the float) were shorted as of Feb. 27.
    • Two weeks ago: Ambarella jumps thanks to strong FQ1 guidance
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • AKS

    Steel companies hurt by import surge but conditions should improve

    • AK Steel (AKS -5.2%) is sharply lower after reporting downside Q1 guidance, citing lower than expected carbon steel spot market shipments and prices due to high levels of what it sees as unfairly traded imports, but most other steel names sport nice gains: X +4.3%, MT +2.9%, NUE +2.8%, STLD +1.9%, WOR +2.5%, CMC +2.3%.
    • Various factors but especially the strong dollar are sparking a surge in steel imports, resulting in a tough Q1 for all U.S. steel producers, but most of the companies also say Q2 and H2 2015 should be a bit better as demand is fairly strong in many end markets (Briefing.com).
    • NUE said this week that steel mill margins for all products should improve in Q2 as it begins to realize the benefits of lower raw materials costs and selling prices begin to stabilize, while STLD said continued strength in domestic steel consumption from the auto, manufacturing and construction sectors should support a stronger Q2 and H2.
    • Credit Suisse analysts prefer US Steel in the group "with the caveat that this is a 1-3 year view."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • ASYS

    Amtech +4.2% following insider buying

    • Amtech (NASDAQ:ASYS) shareholder M3C Holdings discloses it bought 8,787 shares on Tuesday at $11.01, and 10,651 shares on Wednesday at $11.03.
    • The purchases bring M3C's total stake in the chip equipment maker to 227,688 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • ISLE

    Isle of Capri breaks out of the pack again

    • Isle of Capri (NASDAQ:ISLE) rallies hard on strong volume without any news out from the company.
    • The regional casino chain is one of the usual suspects when it comes to M&A or REIT speculation in the gaming sector.
    • Shares of ISLE are up 72% YTD.
    • Casino Management Review published an informative on REITs in the casino sector for those trying to separate the wheat from the chaff.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • VMEM

    Violin Memory +8.6%; director buys 10K shares

    • A week after chairman Richard Nottenburg, CEO Kevin DeNuccio, and three other Violin Memory (NYSE:VMEM) directors disclosed purchases, director Cheemin Bo-Linn (not one of last week's buyers) has disclosed she bought 10K shares on Tuesday at prices ranging from $3.56-$3.58.
    • Violin has recovered yesterday's big losses. 8.6M shares (over 10% of the float) were shorted as of Feb. 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFA

    Reuters: P-E firms prepping Informatica bids

    • Several P-E firms are prepping offers to acquire Informatica (INFA +2%), Reuters reports. The WSJ reported two months ago Informatica had reached out to potential buyers.
    • Reuters' sources state Silver Lake has teamed with Hellman & Friedman ahead of an early-April deadline for final bids, and that Advent International, Permira Advisora, Thoma Bravo, and the P-E arm of Canada's pension investment board are also interested.
    • Shares have spiked to new 52-week highs. Activist Elliott Management is believed to be pushing for a sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • PRCP

    Perceptron up 5.6% after bullish Canaccord launch

    • Canaccord has launched coverage on Perceptron (NASDAQ:PRCP) with a Buy rating and $15 target. Shares have risen to their highest levels since last July.
    • Separately, the 3D scanning hardware vendor has unveiled a small-footprint coordinate measurement machine (CMM) that can be used for "the inspection of high-volume production parts or of single-part inspection at the smaller manufacturing operations" It follows the recent acquisition of Italian CMM maker Coord3 Industries and Czech CMM software developer Next Metrology.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • ICLD

    InterCloud now down 8% post-earnings

    • After opening sharply higher in response to its Q4 results, InterCloud (NASDAQ:ICLD) has reversed course. Shares are now less than $0.30 above a 52-week low of $2.03.
    • Likely contributing to the selloff: Gross margin fell to 21% in Q4 from Q3's 26%. InterCloud blames its relatively modest 200 bps Y/Y GM drop on a mix shift towards hardware sales.
    • While revenue more than doubled Y/Y, operating expenses fell to $11.1M from $11.2M. InterCloud ended Q4 with $5.5M in cash, up from $2.6M at the end of Q3. "Other liabilities," which includes long-term debt, totaled $49.9M.
    • Q4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • LRCX

    Needham cuts Lam target, downgrades Ultra Clean

    • Believing the company will offer soft FQ4 (June quarter) guidance to go with its April FQ3 report, Needham's Edwin Mok has cut his Lam Research (LRCX -0.2%) target by $2 to $93, while reiterating a Buy. Longer-term, he still expects Lam to perform well thanks to a 2H15 sales pickup driven by the company's strong exposure to FinFET (3D transistor) and 3D NAND process investments.
    • Meanwhile, Mok has downgraded Ultra Clean (UCTT -8.6%) to Hold, citing expectations "for a weaker 2Q15 in the SemiCap space and the lack of growth driver for the year." He sees DRAM push-outs hurting Q2 sales, and thinks efforts to win new business will take time to bear fruit.
    • Lam is missing out on a market rally, while Ultra Clean is off sharply. Lam sold off on Wednesday after JPMorgan reported Samsung is slowing the pace of its DRAM investments. Mok downgraded chip manufacturing materials supplier Cabot Microelectronics on Monday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • SARA

    Saratoga Resources extends forbearance agreements with senior lenders

    • Saratoga Resources (SARA +9.4%) says it made a deal with its creditors to delay or possibly avert a debt default, and appoints Jeff Huddleston of the Conway MacKenzie Management consulting firm as interim CFO.
    • SARA is extending the terms of its forbearance agreements with holders of $54.6M in senior debt and 75% of holders of $125.2M in second lien notes until April 30.
    • SARA also says it expects to save $15M/year through its efforts to cut lease operating expenses and G&A costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PRTA +27%. ENVI +24%. CTRP +23%. VBLT +21%. VGGL +20%. CALA +19%. RALY +17%. GMAN +15%. NXTD +14%. VTAE +12% 
    • Losers: EAC -14%. ISNS -12%. BGI -12%. ONE -11%. ONTX -9%. NVGN -9%. OGEN -9%. YOKU -8%. VTL -8%. FOLD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CRCM

    Care.com -4.8% on post-earnings JPMorgan downgrade

    • JPMorgan has downgraded Care.com (NYSE:CRCM) to Neutral a day after the company posted mixed Q4 results and reported a 45% Y/Y increase in members (boosted slightly by M&A) to 14.1M. The firm's target has been cut by $4 to $8.
    • JPM upgraded the child/family care marketplace to Overweight back in Feb. 2014, when shares were at $18.94. They're currently less than $1 above a post-IPO low of $6.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras hits new pre-salt record, but overall production lower

    • Petrobras (PBR +5.1%) says the output from the Santos and Campos basin pre-salt clusters reached a monthly record 737K gross boe/day in February.
    • Despite the pre-salt record, PBR's total oil and natural gas production for the month was 2.8M boe/day, 1.5% lower than January’s 2.845M due mostly to planned maintenance shutdowns of two platforms in the Campos Basin.
    • Separately, PBR says in a new filing that a thorough analysis of its contracts could force it to book asset impairments and losses for last year's Q3 and Q4 which could impact net income, although it has no estimates on the impact yet.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • BIDU

    Bloomberg: $3B+ IPO planned for Sohu/Tencent's Sogou search engine

    • #3 Chinese search engine Sogou is planning an IPO that will feature a $3B+ valuation, Bloomberg reports. Sources add Sogou, which is controlled by Sohu (SOHU +3.7%), could see an offering in 2H15.
    • Sogou has been easily outgrowing Sohu's portal and gaming ops: Its revenue rose 70% Y/Y in Q4 to $119M. It had an estimated 6.9% Q4 Chinese search share, trailing Baidu's (NASDAQ:BIDU) 74.4% and Qihoo's (NYSE:QIHU) 17.3%.
    • Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) bought a 40.9% stake in Sogou in 2013 for $516M, and has integrated Sogou's services with its wildly popular WeChat mobile messaging platform (recently hit 500M MAUs). Aside from search, Sogou's services include a Web directory, games, and popular Chinese-language typing software (Sogou Pinyin).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 7 Comments
  • VBLT

    VBL Therapeutics gets some spillover from Intercept's positive NASH news

    • Thinly-traded nano cap VBL Biogenics (VBLT +23.4%) jumps on a whopping 37x surge in volume as NASH-focused investors, giddy over Intercept Pharma's (ICPT +2.9%) good news, throw their money at other companies in the space.
    • VBL is far behind, though. On March 25, VP of Research and Operations Eyal Breitbart, Ph.D., will present preclinical data on its lead lecinoxoid candidate, VB-201, for the treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) and liver fibrosis at the Liver Metabolism and Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease meeting in Canada.
    • VB-201 has had a rough go of it. In February, shares collapsed when the company announced that it was outperformed by placebo in a trial for psoriasis and ulcerative colitis.
    • Previously: Vascular Biogenics off big premarket on failed clinical trial (Feb. 17)
    • Previously: Intercept Pharma up 10% premarket on NASH trial results (March 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • TOT

    Total reportedly considers selling U.K.’s Frigg gas pipeline

    • Total (TOT +3.7%) is considering a sale of its Frigg natural gas pipeline in the U.K. North Sea, in a deal that could fetch ~$1B, Bloomberg reports.
    • TOT already is said to be exploring the sale of part of its 80%-owned Laggan-Tormore natural gas field, which lies west of the Shetland Islands.
    • The Frigg U.K. system, which covers ~225 miles, transports natural gas from fields across the North Sea to St. Fergus in Scotland.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • TOL

    Homebuilders are day's strongest performers after KB Home results

    • A good week for the homebuilders gets better after KB Home's FQ1 cruised through estimates, and the company said recently contracting profit margins are set to turn the other way for the rest of the year (the stock's up 7%).
    • ITB +2.3%, XHB +1.6%
    • Toll Brothers (TOL +3.2%), Hovnanian (HOV +2.5%), Lennar (LEN +3.6%), Pulte (PHM +2.8%), M/I Homes (MHO +3.6%), D.R. Horton (DHI +2.1%), Ryland (RYL +2.4%), Standard Pacific (SPF +2.8%).
    • Previously: KB Home on the move after earnings beat, margin comments (March 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM | 3 Comments
  • SPG

    Investors bet Simon Property will walk away from Macerich

    • "The bump is pretty underwhelming," says Susquehanna's King She, commenting on Simon Property Group's (SPG +1.6%) boost of its offer to buy Macerich (MAC -4.8%) to $95.50 per share from $91. The April 1 deadline from Simon doesn't bode well for the prospects of a deal:  “You normally like to see a hostile buyer digging in their heels for the long haul.”
    • She's expectation is Macerich will reject the offer within a week and Simon will walk away. Investors agree, taking Macerich down to $87.85 per share in wake of the "final" offer.
    • Macerich confirms its receipt of the new bid, and promises to have a look.
    • Previously: Simon Property sweetens Macerich offer (March 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics nears $10 on Morgan Stanley upgrade

    • Morgan Stanley has upgraded STMicroelectronics (STM +3.4%) to Equal Weight. The European chipmaker is at its highest levels since last May, when shares briefly touched $10.
    • STMicro rallied earlier this week on a BofA/Merril target hike.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • ICL

    Israel Chemicals may look at buying all or part of Chilean miner SQM

    • Israel Chemicals (ICL +0.7%) says buying part or all of Chilean fertilizer company SQM (SQM +7.4%) would make a “good fit... big for us to swallow, but I’m sure we would look at it,” CEO Stefan Borgas says.
    • Opportunities outside Israel have become more attractive for ICL as domestic problems pile up; a windfall tax on resources companies is due to come into effect in 2017 while ICL has failed to win approval for a phosphate mine in Israel because of environmental concerns.
    • SQM plunged 17% Wednesday after Potash Corp. (POT +0.7%) withdrew three directors from the company’s board in protest at the handling of a tax probe.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 10 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen up on study results in Alzheimer's

    • Biogen Idec (BIIB +6.3%) jumps of double normal volume in response to its announcement of positive interim results of a Phase 1b study evaluating BIIB037 (aducanumab) for the treatment of patients with early-stage Alzheimer's disease (AD). Treatment with aducanumab produced a dose- and time-dependent reduction of amyloid plaque in the brain, the buildup of which is believed to play a key role in the development of AD symptoms.
    • The interim analysis involved 166 patients up to Week 54 in four dosage cohorts: placebo, 1 mg/kg, 3 mg/kg and 10 mg/kg. A fifth arm, 6 mg/kg, involved 30-week data. The placebo arm was virtually unchanged at 26 and 54 weeks but there were statistically significant reductions in amyloid plaques in all dosage arms except 1 mg/kg at 26 weeks. At Week 54, greater reductions were observed in the 3 and 10 mg/kg arms (data from the 6 mg/kg arm was not available yet).
    • Biogen group SVP and Chief Medical Officer Alfred Sandrock, M.D., Ph.D., says, "This is the first time an investigational drug for [AD] has demonstrated a statistically significant reduction on amyloid plaque as well as a statistically significant slowing of clinical impairment in patients with prodromal or mild disease. Based on these results, we are advancing the aducanumab clinical program to Phase 3 with plans to initiate enrollment later this year."
    • An estimated 25M people live with AD worldwide. Drug candidates that target amyloid plaque have not been successful in clinical studies to date.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 7 Comments
  • CSLT

    Castlight slumps, Benefitfocus rallies following Wells Fargo launches

    • As part of a broader coverage launch for healthcare software names, Wells Fargo has started Castlight (CSLT -5.1%) at Market Perform and Benefitfocus (BNFT +4.1%) at Outperform.
    • Though still far below a post-IPO high of $41.95, Castlight had rallied strongly over the last week. Benefitfocus soared last month after beating Q4 estimates and announcing health/investment consulting firm and major customer Mercer is taking a 9.9% stake.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • FUN

    Cedar Fair has a good week amid drop in Treasury Note yields

    • Shares of Cedar Fair (NYSE:FUN) are up 1.5% on the day and are now 7.2% higher over the last three sessions.
    • The company is in a quiet period with many of its parks closed making the share price jump notable.
    • The stock trades with a 5.11% yield which may have attracted some income investors with the downturn in mid-term Treasury rates this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • QUNR

    Qunar up 5.3% in response to Ctrip's numbers

    • Qunar (NASDAQ:QUNR) has surged to new 52-week highs yet again after rival Ctrip posted mixed Q4 results and (more importantly) offered Q1 sales guidance that was far above consensus.
    • Qunar is now up 24% since beating Q4 estimates and offering strong Q1 guidance on Monday afternoon. While Ctrip is guiding for 40%-50% Y/Y Q1 sales growth, Qunar (has a much smaller revenue base) is guiding for 85%-90% growth.
    • Shares are now within striking distance of a March 2014 all-time high of $36.73.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • CCG

    Campus Crest -2.8% after downgrade

    • RBC downgrades Campus Crest Communities (CCG -2.8%) to Underperform with $6.50 price target.
    • The move comes after yesterday's disclosure of a delay in the company 10-K filing.
    • Previously: Campus Crest lower after delayed 10-K filing (March 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • VNCE

    Vince Holdings lower again as confidence fades

    • Shares of Vince Holdings (VNCE -4.2%) stay in a post-earnings slump.
    • FY15 EPS guidance from the company came in lower than expectations yesterday, $1.00-$1.05 vs. $0.93 consensus.
    • The apparel seller lost the faith of Piper Jaffray today with the investment firm downgrading it to Neutral from Overweight.
    • Piper chopped its price target in half to $18.
    • Previously: Vince beats by $0.02, misses on revenue (Mar. 19 2015)
    • Previously: More on Vince's Q4 (Mar. 19 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • FCX

    Output still halted at Freeport McMoRan's Grasberg mine

    • The blockade by workers at Freeport McMoRan's (FCX +2%) Grasberg mine in Indonesia extends into a fifth day with output still halted.
    • FCX says it is working with the group involved in the demonstration to resolve their concerns, which relate to a settlement reached with other employees at the end of a previous dispute and is not union-backed.
    • A lengthy disruption to supplies from one of the world's biggest copper mines could support benchmark metal prices that have dropped ~7% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • EXTR

    Extreme -5.5% on Raymond James downgrade

    • Raymond James has downgraded Extreme Networks (NASDAQ:EXTR) to Market Perform.
    • The downgrade comes with Extreme trading well below last summer's levels. Shares bounced a little after the Ethernet/Wi-Fi hardware vendor posted an FQ2 beat on Jan. 28.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • MTGE

    American Capital Mortgage hit with downgrade after dividend cut

    • The company last night cut its quarterly dividend to $0.50 per share vs. $0.65 previously. It's enough for Wunderlich to throw in the towel on its Buy call, and the firm downgrades to Hold with price target cut to $18.50 from $21.50.
    • The cut isn't a total surprise to Jason Stewart at Compass Point who downgraded the stock six weeks ago on worry that margin pressure had boosted the chances of a reduction in the dividend.
    • The current price of $18.12 is a 17.3% discount to Dec. 31 book value.
    • MTGE -1.7%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 24 Comments
  • SPEX

    Spherix +28.5%; claim construction order issued for VTech/Uniden suits

    • The Northern Texas district judge presiding over Spherix's (NASDAQ:SPEX) cordless phone patent infringement suits against VTech and Uniden has issued a 106-page claim construction order covering 13 claims in dispute.
    • Spherix declares it's pleased with the order, which follows a November Markman hearing. "We are impressed by the depth of the Court's reasoning and we are satisfied with the results on the merits."
    • Among other things, the court rejected VTech/Uniden's arguments for invalidating Spherix's '599 patent for indefiniteness, and also their construction of a limitation within the patent. Their construction of terms within Spherix's '899 and '614 patents were also rejected.
    • In addition, Spherix thinks the order "casts doubt on the merits of Defendants' pending [inter partes review] Petitions" with the USPTO (previous). "The Patent Trial and Appeal Board instituted the IPRs without having the benefit of Spherix's expert testimony and without seeing the cross-examination of the Defendants' experts on the statements made in their IPR declarations. We believe the Court's claim construction order casts substantial doubt on the credibility of these experts..."
    • Shares have soared towards $1.00 on the news. They had fallen sharply in recent weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM | 1 Comment

  • Oil spikes, dollar plummets - what gives?

    • Was there a surprise rate cut we didn't hear about? The bottom has dropped out of the dollar over the past few minutes and oil is rocketing higher.
    • USO +3.4%, UUP -1.2% premarket.
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UUP, UCO, SCO, UDN, BNO, UGA, DTO, DBO, UWTI, USL, DWTI, UHN, DNO, UUPT, FORX, UDNT, SZO, USDU, OLO, OLEM, TWTI
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 64 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PRTA +40%. VGGL +21%. CTRP +19%. VBLT +15%. RALY +14%. ICLD +10%. BIIB +10%. ICPT +8%. SBS +7%. NKE +6%. CIG +6%.
    • Losers: MAC -8%. AKS -6%. THRX -5%. YOKU -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • GLBR

    FXCM to cover first $50K in client losses

    • Updating its negative balance policy, FXCM now offers customers protection for the first $50K of losses over a 24-hour period. Clients will be responsible for losses above that amount, no matter the market conditions.
    • The company was nearly wiped out after clients lost hundreds of millions overnight when the SNB cut the euro loose from the franc.
    • Shares +3.4% premarket

  • ICPT

    Intercept Pharma up 10% premarket on NASH trial results

    • Intercept Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ICPT) jumps 10% premarket on modest volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a new subgroup analysis from its Phase 2b FLINT study of obeticholic acid (OCA) in patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). The company is presenting the data today at the American Association for the Study of Liver Disease and Industry Colloquium in New York.
    • In a subgroup of high-risk NASH patients (n=160; OCA=84; placebo=76), greater proportions of OCA-treated patients experienced improvements in three areas versus placebo: NASH resolution (OCA=18%; placebo=5%; p=0.014); NAFLD (histological) activity score improvement by 2 points (OCA=60%; placebo=30%; p=0.0004) and liver fibrosis by at least one stage: (OCA=39%; placebo=21%; p=0.007). In obese patients, the proportions with at least one stage improvement in liver fibrosis were: OCA=39%; placebo=18%; p=0.003.
    • Treatment with OCA for 72 weeks also demonstrated improvements in other markers for cardiovascular risk such as body weight, systolic blood pressure and triglyceride/HDL ratio.
    • The company is developing OCA, a farnesoid X receptor (FXR) agonist, for the treatment of primary biliary cirrhosis (PBC), NASH and other chronic liver diseases. FXR is a bile acid receptor that plays a key role in bile acid, cholesterol, lipid and glucose metabolism.
    • A rolling New Drug Application (NDA) with the FDA is underway for PBC and should be completed in Q2 (in addition to a Marketing Authorization Application in Europe). The commercial launch is planned in both the U.S. and Europe for 2016.
